pageContext.description: An unidentified cast copper-alloy object of a type usually referred to as 'moustache-like' or 'moustache shaped'. These objects are thought to date from the Middle Bronze Age to the Late Iron Age, after the discovery of one in the Salisbury Hoard (Stead 1998; ref. 117) and various other finds reported to the PAS which are associated with Middle Bronze Age material. It has been suggested that they are part of sword scabbard chapes however their true function remains uncertain. For a similar object see HAMP-C04CC3.
pageContext.notes: Image provided by the finder - object not seen by the FLO.
